Acid Mothers Temple.title: 10000 Light Years Astro Marathon Explosion vol.1
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O.
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
This is the live recording at Helluva Lounge Kobe as the third day of “Acid Mothers Olympic 2021”.
This show was announced “10000 Light Years Astro Marathon Explosion”, the group played non-stop 100 min. set.
This album is included the first half of the show. This digital live album was released only for Bandcamp.

released August 6, 2021

2. From Planet Orb With Love - Good-Bye Mrs. Uranus ~ Black Summer Song

Kawabata Makoto : guitar, speed guru
Higashi Hiroshi : synthesizer,
Jyonson Tsu : voice, guitar, bouzouki, midnight whistler
Satoshima Nani : drums, another dimension
Taigen Kawabe : bass, voice (from Bo Ningen)
All music by Kawabata Makoto (except for #1, trad. arranged)
All words by Jyonson Tsu (except for #1, trad. )
Recorded live at Helluva Lounge (Kobe) 24th July 2021

Acid Mothers Temple.title: 2010: A Space Ritual  2010年宇宙の祭典
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple with Kido Natsuki
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
Recorded live at the 9th Acid Mothers Temple Festival in December 2010!
Psychedelia incarnate Acid Mothers Temple were joined transcendent guitarist and self-described Gong fan Kido Natsuki (from Korekyojin, etc).
This was total improvisation and tumultuous soul exchange combining to create a psychedelic mandala suite!
The original CD was released by Acid Mothers Temple label in 2011.
This is the first time to digital reissue.

Acid Mothers Temple.title: Acid Mothers Doravideo
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple with Ichiraku Yoshimitsu
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
Ichiraku Yoshimitsu (a.k.a. doravideo) joined Acid Mothers Temple @ "7th Acid Mothers Temple Festival" in 2008.
Ichiraku was a drummer of AMT in 2001 (he played on many AMT's albums, "In C", "New Geocentric World", "Absolutely Freak Out" and more...). Also he is a unique solo musician / media artist, at that time he used his drum kit as a video controller, controlling the video at the same time as he played.
This is live recording of Acid Mothers Temple with Ichiraku Yoshimitsu @ "7th Acid Mothers Temple Festival" in 2008.
The original CD was released by Acid Mothers Temple label in 2010.
This is the first time to digital reissue.

Acid Mothers Temple.title: Acid Mothers Temple 1995 - 1997 vol.1
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O.
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
This original cassette tape "Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O. 1"was released for Mainliner US tour in Feb.1997.
And reissued on dbl LP by Synesthetic Recordings in Nov. 2007 as "The Early Acid Mothers Temple Recordings 1995 - 1997", then as a dbl CD by OHM Records/Synesthetic Recordings in Jun. 2016.
This is the pre-1st album, some tracks are early version.
[ liner notes from reissue by Synesthetic Recordings]
In 1995 the quartet of Kawabata Makoto (Musica Transonic, Mainliner, Toho Sara), Koizumi Hajime (ex. Mainliner, ex. Seventh Seal), Suhara Keizo (Arijigoku, Rashinban), and Cotton Casino (Mady Gula Blue Heaven) formed a new group and started to record their improvised jam sessions. The group did not yet have a name at this point in their existence. A group of social dropouts of every description - musicians, dancers, artists, farmers, channellers, ex-yakuza, mermaid researchers and professional vagrants - known as the Acid Mothers Temple Soul Collective, had already begun to coalesce around Kawabata.
Several years earlier Kawabata had spent some time in a beatnik commune in Nagano, but he soon left, having become repulsed by their exclusionary left-wing ideology and hypocritical ecological activities. In response he had founded his own commune, one without any political ideology or ethics save that of non-interference in each other's lives. The mission of this "hometown of souls" would be to open its doors to anyone who was still searching for something in life.
Around the same time Kawabata had become involved in the Tokyo underground scene through his role as guitarist with Musica Transonic. Determined to do something to introduce the world to the other members of the Acid Mothers Temple Soul Collective, he decided to invite them to join his as yet untitled new improvising jam band. His old friend Higashi Hiroshi and many other members of the collective started to participate in the group's recording sessions. This would be the beginning of Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O. (AMT).
In 1996 a limited edition cassette entitled Acid Mother's Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O. (note that the band's name was spelled with an apostrophe in the beginning) was sold at an event that Kawabata played at. This was the first release to bear the AMT name, and it included recordings by the original quartet, an early take of "Speed Guru", and other recordings dating from 1995 and early 1996.
In 1997, Kawabata joined Mainliner on their US and European tour. He took with him two limited edition cassettes entitled Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O. 1 and Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O. 2, which were sold at gigs on the tour. They consisted of recordings from 1995 to 1997, including tracks by the original quartet with added overdubs and newly recorded tracks. After the tour ended, Kawabata went back to work on these pieces, mixing and adding new overdubs. These would eventually become the recordings that were released by PSF as the band's eponymous first album (PSFD-93), so the original cassettes may be considered as "demo" versions of that record.
While these early recordings were released under the AMT name, they were in fact closer in concept to Kawabata's solo albums. Recordings of improvised jams were manipulated using musique concrete methodology and remade into Kawabata's personal image of psychedelic music. There was no intention for the group to play live, and in fact there were no gigs in the first few years. But when the first PSF album was released, Kawabata decided to tour overseas for the first time in June 1998. Soon afterwards Tsuyama Atsushi joined the group, and began to cement its identity as a live band. The process of transformation from a Kawabata solo project into a group was one that began around this time and still continues today.
Acid Mothers Temple.credits:
released February 5, 2021
1. From The Melting Paraiso U.F.O.
2. The Acid Mothers Prayer
3. Amphetamine A Go Go
4. Aum Over Drive
5. Speed Guru
Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O. :
Kawabata Makoto guitar, synthesizer, sarangi, voices
Higashi Hiroshi : guitar
Koizumi Hajime : drums, percussion, saxophone
Takahashi Atsuki : drums
Sahara Keizo : bass
Yasuda Hisashi : percussion
Sakakibara Daiji : didgeridoo
Mano Kazuhiko : saxophone
Ishida Yoko : violin
Cotton Casino : vocals, sitar
Johan Wellens : cosmic narration
recorded at Acid Mothers Temple, 1995 - 1997
produced, engineered and mixed by Kawabata Makoto

Acid Mothers Temple.title: AMT calendar 2025 + Digital single
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O.
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
As a way of expressing our gratitude to our friends and ardent fans who have always been so kind to us, we are producing the ACID MOTHERS TEMPLE calendar, albeit in a very small number of copies.
We have been receiving more and more inquiries from overseas every year, so this year we have decided to sell a small number of copies via Bandcamp.
We also sell the Christmas songs recorded on the the COVID-19 pandemic as digital singles.

Acid Mothers Temple.title: AMT24
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O.
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
Acid Mothers Temple's discography is vast and can be likened to a labyrinth, so the band has released a 24-hour compilation album digitally that traces the history of the band.
However, it was impossible to cover all of their works in 24 hours, so we have compiled our works from the first album to 2007, a decade of work, in 24 hours.
For this release, Kawabata Makoto re-mastered all the songs and produced a special mix version.
At the end of the album, there is a new song from a new album by the current members and a rare live recording of a performance with Simeon (Silver Apples), who passed away 2020.

Acid Mothers Temple.title: AMT24 vol.2
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O.
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
Acid Mothers Temple's discography is vast and can be likened to a labyrinth, which is why the band has released digitally the second of a series of 24-hour compilation albums tracing the band's history.
However, it is impossible to cover all our work in 24 hours, so as a sequel to the last installment, this time we have compiled in 24 hours the 10 years of their work from "Acid Motherly Love (2007)" to "Astrogasm From The Inner Space (2014)".
For this release, Makoto Kawabata remastered all the songs and created special mixed versions.
The album ends with a new song from the limited lathe cut 7” EP by the current members.
Acid Mothers Temple.credits:
released September 6, 2024

Acid Mothers Temple.title: Black Magic Satori
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple & Space Paranoid
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
[Acid Mothers Temple & Space Paranoid]
An Acid Mothers Temple unit formed in 2013 at the request of our Spanish booking agent, who wanted to see Acid Mothers Temple playing Black Sabbath. A new unit was duly formed and toured the Iberian peninsula.
Originally the group's existence was to be limited to this one tour, however we realised that both AMT＆The Melting Paraiso U.F.O. and AMT＆The Cosmic Inferno had long moved beyond their original psychedelic heavy rock roots to play a wide range of music. So we decided to keep Acid Mothers Temple & Space Paranoid as a permanent unit that would focus just on spacey heavy rock.
We were determined to draw a line between us and the many doom metal and black metal bands who have also been inspired by Black Sabbath. So, placing Sabbath back into the early seventies context of their birth, we have defined them as a British blues rock band. To this template we have added sixties psychedelic elements, as well as an improvisational approach (something that Sabbath virtually never do live), and we have attempted to reconstruct their songs in heavier and spacier way. The group will not limit itself to Black Sabbath covers, but will consider to explore the possibilities of ever spacier, ever heavier blues rock.
This is the only one studio album of Acid Mothers Temple & Space Paranoid. The group broke up in 2017.
The original LP was released by Safety Meeting Records, and the CD was released by Chaotic Noise Recordings in 2013.
This digital album was remastered for Bandcamp by Kawabata Makoto.
Acid Mothers Temple.credits:
released December 4, 2020
1. Black Magic Satori
2. Devil Inside
3. Space Paranoid
Acid Mothers Temple & Space Paranoid :
Kawabata Makoto : guitars, speed guru
Higashi Hiroshi : synthesizer, dancin'king
Tabata Mitsuru : bass, voice, maratab
Okano Futoshi : drums, godspeed
all words by Tabata Mitsuru
all music by Kawabata Makoto (except for track3)
recorded at Acid Mothers Temple on 17th & 18th July 2013
produced, engineered & mixed by Kawabata Makoto
remastered by Kawabata Makoto
illustration by Martial Brouté
original band concept by Jose Luis Cuevas

Acid Mothers Temple.title: God Bless Acid Mothers Temple
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O.
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
This is a compilation of recordings from the 2001 Monster of the Universe tour.
This original CDR is "UK 1" that was distributed at the first "AMT Festival" at Tokuzo in Nagoya on 7th December 2002. People who had bought tickets in advance were able to exchange their ticket stub for one of three different cdr titles: “USA”, “UK 1” or “UK 2”.
This digital album was released for celebrating 20th anniversary of AMT's first full-scale UK/Ireland tour.

Acid Mothers Temple.title: Great Debauchees Go To Prison
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O.
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
This is an unreleased live recording in Slovenia 2004.
2004 is the first year a founder member / vocalist Cotton left the band, the bassist Tsuyama replaced her.
The founder member / drummer Koizumi Hajime came back to the tour line-up in 2004. (He is also a founder member of Mainliner too.)
This is really rare recording that Higashi Hiroshi plays guitar solo on middle part of “Pink Lady Lemonade”.
The original source is stereo recording direct from the mixing board, but the balance of each instruments were so horrible. Kawabata analog-remastered for releasing on Bandcamp.
This digital live album was released only for Bandcamp.
Acid Mothers Temple.credits:
released October 1, 2021
1. Torturous Torture
2. Dark Stars In The Dazzling Sky
3. La Le Lo
4. Cimpo No Que
5. Pink Lady Lemonade
6. Zombie You ~ La Novia
Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O. - at the time of this live recording were :
Tsuyama Atsushi : monster bass, vocal, cosmic joker
Higashi Hiroshi : synthesizer, guitar, chorus, dancin’king
Koizumi Hajime : drums, sleeping monk
Kawabata Makoto : guitar, chorus, speed guru
Recorded live at Kud France Preseren (Ljubljana) 18th November 2004
Produced and mastered by Kawabata Makoto

Acid Mothers Temple.title: Heavenly Hellfire Overlord
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O.
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
This is an unreleased live recording in 2004.
The venue was underground of a church, and no air-conditioning. Three bands played before us, the hall was already like a hell more than a sauna, too hot and sticky. We felt the sound was bended by too high temperature and humidity. It was the hottest and toughest show ever.
This original source is a VHS video tape that John Gibbon of Bardo Pond filmed.
This digital live album was released only for Bandcamp.
Acid Mothers Temple.credits:
released November 5, 2021

2. La Le Lo
3. Pink Lady Lemonade (You’re Scalding Hot) ~ Spiritual Phenomenal Outro
Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O. -at the time of this live recording were:
Tsuyama Atsushi : bass, voice, recorder, cosmic joker
Higashi Hiroshi : synthesizer, guitar, voice, dancin’king
Koizumi Hajime : drums, percussion, sleeping monk
Kawabata Makoto : guitar, guitar-theremin, voice, speed guru
recorded live at First Unitarian Church (Philadelphia) and John & Isobel’s house on 18th June 2004
recorded and filmed by John Gibbon
Edited and mastered by Kawabata Makoto

Acid Mothers Temple.title: Hotter Than Hell in London 2015
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple & The Cosmic Inferno
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
This special line up of Acid Mothers Temple & The Cosmic Inferno was happened just for "MIMI Festival" in Marseille 2015.
We've played 3 shows, The Doom in London, "MMI Festival" in Marseille and Club Goodman in Tokyo then.
Though Acid Mothers Temple & The Cosmic Inferno has gone on a hiatus, The present Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O. took many songs over from this group.
It's the only one release of this special one up, also this digital album was released only for Bandcamp.

Acid Mothers Temple.title: Invasion Of Kobe 2023
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O.
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
This is the latest unreleased live recording with the present line-up.
This live album was recorded on the next day of the digital live album “Live at Namba Bears 2023”, the band played more improvisation even almost same set list. Also they played “Electric Love Machine” for dedicate to Hiroshi Na who passed away on 24th March 2023. (Hiroshi Na plays lead guitar on “Electric Love Machine” from the album “Univers Zen Ou De Zéro À Zéro”.)
This digital live album was released only for Bandcamp.
Acid Mothers Temple.credits:
released May 5, 2023

2. From Planet Orb With Love ~ Good-Bye Mrs. Uranus

Acid Mothers Temple.title: last Concert In Tokyo
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O.
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
This live recording in 1999 is the whole set of the last concert in Tokyo at that time.
(We had never played in Tokyo until 2007 when we had a show with Trad Gras och Stenar there.)
Also this is the first show with the bassist Tsuyama Atsushi.
The original CD was released as a part of "Official Bootleg Series" by Acid Mothers Temple label in 2003.
This is really rare live recording of early Acid Mothers Temple.
This digital album was remastered for Bandcamp by Kawabata Makoto.

Koizumi Hajime : drums
Kawabata Makoto : guitar
recorded live at Mandala2 (Tokyo) 15th Feb. 1999
produced and remastered by Kawabata Makoto

Surely this is the existing earliest live recording of Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O. .
This is the third gig of Acid Mothers Temple’s history.(The debut gig was at Transmission Theater in San Francisco on 6th June, second gig was at Eimer in Berlin on 10th June)

Acid Mothers Temple.title: Live in Tolosa [remastered]
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple et Rosina de Peira
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
The original dbl LP and CD were released by BamBalam Rercords in 2014.
This is the historical live recording of Acid Mothers Temple with the Occitan traditional singer Rosina de Peira. (It was second time to play together. The first time was in Toulouse 2002.)
“La Nòvia” is well known as Acid Mothers Temple’s cover of the Occitan traditional song. We discovered this song from Rosina de Peira e Martina’s “Ié (1982)” from Revolum.
Kawabata remastered for digital release on Bandcamp 2022.
Acid Mothers Temple.credits:
released April 1, 2022
1. La Nòvia
2. Pink Lady Lemonade ~ OM Riff From The Melting Paraiso U.F.O. ~ Pink Lady Lemonade coda
3. La Le Lo
4. Som-Som ~ Cometary Orbital Drive
Tsuyama Atsushi : bass, voice
Higashi Hiroshi : synthesizer, voice
Tabata Mitsuru : guitar, guitar synthesizer, voice
Shimura Koji : drums
Kawabata Makoto : guitar, voice
et
Rosina de Peira : chant
recorded live at Connexxion Café (Toulouse), 15th November 2012
engineered by Amic Bedel
converted M/S to L/R stereo by Audrey Ginestet
produced by Kawabata Makoto
remastered by Kawabata Makoto 2022

Acid Mothers Temple.title: Mega Psychedelia
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Yamamoto Seiichi & Acid Mothers Temple
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
This second collaboration between Yamamoto Seiichi (Boredoms, Rovo, Omoide Hatoba) and Acid Mothers Temple goes far beyond the "Giant Psychedelia" of their first joint release, towards "Mega Psychedelia" in search of the ultimate ecstatic psych sound! An utter gem of an album, brimfull of Yamamoto's gorgeous psychedelic guitar play!
The original CD was released by Acid Mothers Temple label in 2011
Acid Mothers Temple.credits:
released May 7, 2021
1. Space Introduction ~ Planet Dreaming Turtles ~ Brain Stormbringer
2. Electric ~ Pink Lady Lemonade Acid 2009
3. Cometary Orbital Driver ~ Mega Psychedelia Or Absolutely Mu
Yamamoto Seiichi & Acid Mothers Temple are :
Yamamoto Seiichi : guitar
Tsuyama Atsushi : bass, voice, acoustic guitar
Shimura Koji : drums
Higashi Hiroshi : synthesizer
Kawabata Makoto : guitar, electric bouzouki, electronics
with
OHPIA (Yamato, Akira, Miyuki) : light show
all tracks were completely improvised by Yamamoto Seiichi & Acid Mothers Temple (except for riffs of Pink Lady Lemonade and Cometary Orbital Drive).
recorded live at Tokuzo (Nagoya) "AMT Festival vol.8" on 12th Dec. 2009
engineered by Usui Yasuhiro (Tokuzo)
produced and mixed by Kawabata Makoto
digital mastered by Yoshida Tatsuya

Acid Mothers Temple.title: Monsters Of The Universe attacked Iron Man City
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O.
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
This is a rare live recording of early days of Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O..
This "Monster Of The Universe Tour" was our first UK/Ireland tour.
You can listen to rarely Higashi's guitar solo on Pink Lady Lemonade.
The drummer Ichiraku toured with us in 2001 one year only. Now he retired drummer, he has played modular synthesizer and laser beams as "doravideo".
The original CDR was released by Riot Season as just promotional copies in 2013.
Kawabata edited and remastered for this digital release.
This digital album was released only for Bandcamp.

Acid Mothers Temple.title: Pink Lady A Go Go : Live in Lisbon 2022
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O.
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
The brand-new live recording from “MetaReboot Tour in Europe 2022”.
On this show, there was the strict regulation about maximum volume. Kawabata didn’t use one of his amp Roland JC-120, used only Marshall JCM-900.
Kawabata had looked for any chance to play a kind of special set for a long time, finally the time was coming. The group played only 2 song for 55 min., “Pink Lady Lemonade” and “Cometary Orbital Drive” both songs are led by minimal guitar riffs, rhythm section (Satoshima Nani on drums and Sawano Shozo on bass) developed songs. They played like “minimal trance set”.
This digital live album was released for only Bandcamp.
Acid Mothers Temple.credits:
released November 4, 2022
1. Pink Lady Lemonade ~ Sparkling Pink Lady Lemonade
2. Cometary Orbital Drive
Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O. - at the time of this live recording were :
Kawabata Makoto : guitar, speed guru
Higashi Hiroshi : synthesizer, fishin’god
Jyonson Tsu : voice, guitar, midnight whistler
Satoshima Nani : drums, another dimension
Sawano Shozo : bass, hex man
music by Kawabata Makoto
words by Jyonson Tsu
recorded live at Musicbox (Lisbon), 2nd November 2022
produced by Kawabata Makoto

Acid Mothers Temple.title: Space Troubadour Chanson 2019 vol.1
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O.
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
This is an unreleased live recording of “Space Troubadour Chanson set” featuring Jyonson Tsu in Osaka 2019.Even featuring Jyonson’s vocal, the band didn’t play quiet, coz “This is folky but we’ve never said playing quiet“!
At this night, the group played non-stop 120 min. set. This album is included the first half of the show. This digital live album was released only for Bandcamp.

released December 3, 2021

Acid Mothers Temple.title: Speed Guru
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mother's Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O.
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
The original cassette tape was released by Nanjo Asahito's La Musica. (probably 1998 or 1999)
the sources were incomplete demo recordings of early Acid Mother's Temple. Nanjo equalized and distorted to his trademark "Nanjo Sound".
When Kawabata got these tracks of this cassette tape, he remastered for upload on Bandcamp.
The tracks included here were later completed and included on the first cassette tape and the first album.
Acid Mothers Temple.credits:
released December 1, 2023
1. Temple On The Lake
2. Cosmic Rocket'N'Roll
3. The Acid Mothers Prayer
4. Speed Guru
Acid Mother's Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O. :
Cotton Casino : voice, synthesizer
Suhara Keizo : bass
Momo : bass
Higashi Hiroshi : guitar, synthesizer
Koizumi Hajime : drums, percussion
Kawabata Makoto : guitar, bouzouki, synthesizer
all songs by Acid Mother's Temple
recorded at Temple Studio 1995 by Kawabata Makoto
mastered at La Musica Studio 1996 by Nanjo Asahito
remastered by Kawabata Makoto in Nov. 2023
special thanks to Eva Goodrich

Acid Mothers Temple.title: Stones, Women And Records At Takutaku 2009
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple SWR With Umezu Kazutoki + Yamamoto Seiichi
Acid Mothers Temple.about: Acid Mothers Temple SWR, the most insane and superb power trio by Yoshida Tatsuya (Ruins) and Tsuyama Atsushi (ex. Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O.) and Kawabata Makoto in the history of Acid Mothers Temple, invites a free jazz saxophone player Umezu Kazutoki and Boredoms guitarist Seiichi Yamamoto for a crazy night of raging, completely improvised psychedelic sound mandala!
Acid Mothers Temple.credits:
released September 6, 2024
1. Today I remained utterly unmoved when I dug up the time capsule I buried three days ago… 三日前に埋めたタイムカプセルを今日掘り返してもなんの感慨もわかない…
2. The Stiff Neck Quartet 肩こりカルテット
3. Keep your sticky mitts off the azuki futures market! Part 1 ~ Alibi Lullaby小豆相場に手をだすな! Pt. 1 〜 アリバイ・ララバイ
4. Super Golden Special Campaign スーパー・ゴールデン・スペシャル・キャンペーン
5. March of the Planetary Monks (those who seek the true path of fidgeting meditation) 惑星坊主の行進(座禅で貧乏ゆすりしながら進む者たち)
6. Jazz – the approaching beggar ジャズ、、来るべきものもらい、、
7. Keep your sticky mitts off the azuki futures market! Part 2 ~ Part 100 小豆相場に手をだすな! Pt. 2 〜 Pt. 100
Acid Mothers Temple SWR :
Yoshida Tatsuya : drums, sampler, voice
Tsuyama Atsushi : bass, voice
Kawabata Makoto : guitar, guitar synthesizer
with
Umezu Kazutoki : saxophone
Yamamoto Seiichi : guitar, biwa
All music is completely improvised.
Recorded live at Taku Taku (Kyoto) on 22 Jan, 2009.
Special thanks to Alan Cummings

Acid Mothers Temple.title: Stubnitz 2006
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple & The Cosmic Inferno
Acid Mothers Temple.about: This is an unreleased live recording in Rostock 2006 that was the first tour of Acid Mothers Temple & The Cosmic Inferno. The drummer Okano quit the band in early 2007, it was the final tour with the original line-up. And this is rare live recording that the band covered Italian prog rock band Area’s “Luglio, Agosto, Settembre (Nero)”. This is recorded directly from soundboard, and live mixed by the sound engineer at the show. This digital live album was released only for Bandcamp.
Acid Mothers Temple.credits:
released March 3, 2023

2. Trigger In Trigger Out

Kawabata Makoto : guitar, speed guru
Higashi Hiroshi : synthesizer, guitar, voice, dancin’king
Tabata Mitsuru : bass, bass-synthesizer, voice, maratab
Shimura Koji : drums, latino cool
Okano Futoshi : drums, god speed
recorded live at Stubnitz (Rostock), 13th June 2006
produced by Kawabata Makoto

Acid Mothers Temple.title: The Origin of Acid Mothers Temple
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mother’s Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O.
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
The original cassette tape was self-released in 1996. It was sold by Kawabata in an edition of 10 at a gig organized by Tsurubami’s drummer Emi Nobuko.
The cassette also featured a track called “Psycho Line”, but it was considered to be of inferior musical value and has been omitted from this reissue.
In this time, an unreleased track “Big Foot Eva” was added as a bonus track.
Early jams dating from the dawn of Acid Mothers Temple, recorded in 1995 and early 1996. At the beginning they spelt the group’s name with an apostrophe (Mother’s) before later changing it to the current Mothers.
Acid Mothers Temple.credits:
released May 6, 2022
1. Freak Out Mu
2. Speed Guru
3. Big Foot Eva (* bonus track)
Acid Mother’s Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O. - at the time of this recording were :
Cotton Casino : voice, synthesizer
Suhara Keizou : bass
Koizumi Hajime : drums, percussion
Momo : bass
Higashi Hiroshi : guitar
Mano Kazuhiko : saxophone
Suzuki Chisen : voice, percussion
Kawabata Makoto : guitar
recorded at Acid Mothers Temple, 1995 - 1996
produced, engineered and mixed by Kawabata Makoto

Acid Mothers Temple.title: Tokyo Assassin 1998
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O.
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
This is unreleased rare live recording of early Acid Mothers Temple in 1998.
The band toured in Japan with Tabata’s Leningrad Blues Machine just after their first Europe & US tour, and it was first time of tour in Japan, too.
Tsuyama joined adventitiously. (He joined as the bassist in next year.)
This digital live album was released only for Bandcamp.
Acid Mothers Temple.credits:
released November 5, 2021
1. Expansive Meditation ~ Blue Velvet Blues ~ Speed Guru
Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O. -at the time of this live recording were:
Cotton Casino : voice, synthesizer
Higashi Hiroshi : synthesizer, guitar
Koizumi Hajime : drums, percussion
Yasuda Hisashi : synthesizer
Kawabata Makoto : guitar
and
Tsuyama Atsushi : guitar, synthesizer
recorded live at Show Boat (Tokyo) 15th Nov. 1998

Acid Mothers Temple.title: Toronto 2015
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O.
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
This is an unreleased live recording in Toronto 2015. It was the bassist / vocalist Tsuyama’s last North American tour. Also the present drummer Satoshima Nani’s first year.
This is rare that the band played new song “Benzaiten” from the new album, that’s why the band has never played this song after Tsuyama left from the band. In middle of the set, Nani broke his bass drum head completely, so he moved floor tom as bass drum in the end of the set.
This digital live album was released only for Bandcamp.
Acid Mothers Temple.credits:
released March 3, 2023
1. Dark Stars in The Dazzling Sky
2. Benzaiten
3. Pink Lady Lemonade ~ IAO Chant From The Melting Paraiso U.F.O. ~ Pink Lady Lemonade coda
4. Nanique Another Dimention ~ Cometary Orbital Drive
Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O. - at the time of this live recording were :
Tsuyama Atsushi : bass, voice, recorder, cosmic joker
Kawabata Makoto : guitar, synthesizer, voice, speed guru
Higashi Hiroshi : synthesizer, voice, dancin’king
Tabata Mitsuru : guitar, guitar-synthesizer, voice, maratab
Satoshima Nani : drums, another dimension
recorded live at The Garrison (Toronto), 1st May 2015
recorded and mixed by Avery Strok
produced by Kawabata Makoto

Acid Mothers Temple.title: Totally Nullust
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O.
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
This is the brand-new live recording from “MetaReboot North American Spring Tour 2023”.
The line-up is featuring Ron Anderson (PAK, The Molecules) on bass as a support member to replace Sawano Shozo who couldn’t come to US by unvaccinated.
The band plays “Interstellar Overdrop” that is parody of Pink Floyd’s “Interstellar Overdrive”.
This digital live album was released only for Bandcamp.
Acid Mothers Temple.credits:
released May 5, 2023
1. Blue Velvet Blues ~ Dark Star Blues
2. From Planet Orb With Love ~ Good-Bye Mrs. Uranus
3. Interstellar Overdrop
4. Flying Teapot ~ Cometary Orbital Drive
Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O. - at the time of this live recording were :
Kawabata Makoto : guitar, speed guru
Higashi Hiroshi : synthesizer, fishin’god
Jyonson Tsu : voice, guitar, bouzouki, midnight whistler
Satoshima Nani : drums, another dimension
Ron Anderson : bass
recorded live at Record Bar (Kansas City), 1st May 2023
produced by Kawabata Makoto

Acid Mothers Temple.title: Voice From Ghostwood
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O.
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
This original micro cassette tape was released, and reissued on CDR by Sounds From The Pocket in 2020.
Also Lombra Records reissued it on limited 10” with a bonus track though, unfortunately this reissue came to a standstill for some serious trouble, they could release only several copies.
This album is dedicated to David Lynch’s Twin Peaks.

Acid Mothers Temple.title: Wild Gals A Go-Go [complete version]
Acid Mothers Temple.artist: Acid Mothers Temple & The Melting Paraiso U.F.O.
Acid Mothers Temple.about:
This is the original Russian underground Ivan Piskov's film soundtrack.
The original CD was released by Acid Mothers Temple label on Nov. 2000.
It was reissued on dbl LP set by Eclipse Records in 2004. This reissue includes one bonus track, however due to the time restrictions for vinyl, the first track has been shortened.
But this digital album includes this bonus track and unedited original tracks.
